title: Box Breathing (4–4–4–4)
description: A paced breathing technique used to reset the nervous system and regain control during anxiety or stress.
steps: Sit comfortably with your back supported.
Inhale gently through your nose for 4 seconds.
Hold your breath for 4 seconds.
Exhale slowly through your mouth for 4 seconds.
Pause for 4 seconds before the next inhale.
Repeat for 4–6 cycles.

title: 4–7–8 Relaxing Breath
description: A powerful breathing technique to slow the heart rate and prepare the body for deep relaxation.
steps: Inhale quietly through your nose for 4 seconds.
Hold the breath for 7 seconds.
Exhale with a soft whooshing sound for 8 seconds.
Repeat 4 cycles.
Use before sleep or during high stress.

title: Coherent Breathing
description: This method helps balance the autonomic nervous system by breathing at 5–6 breaths per minute.
steps: Sit upright or lie down.
Inhale slowly for 5 seconds.
Exhale slowly for 5 seconds.
Keep a steady rhythm without forcing the breath.
Repeat for 5 minutes.

title: Diaphragmatic Belly Breathing
description: A deep breathing exercise that reduces physical tension and stimulates the vagus nerve.
steps: Place one hand on your belly and the other on your chest.
Inhale through your nose, letting your belly rise.
Exhale slowly through pursed lips while the belly falls.
Avoid lifting your chest.
Continue for 5–7 minutes.

title: Alternate Nostril Breathing
description: A yoga-based breathing method to stabilize emotions and improve mental clarity.
steps: Sit comfortably and relax your shoulders.
Close your right nostril with your thumb.
Inhale through the left nostril.
Switch nostrils using your ring finger.
Exhale through the right nostril.
Repeat alternating sides.

title: 5–4–3–2–1 Sensory Grounding
description: A grounding technique using your senses to reconnect to the present moment.
steps: Name 5 things you can see.
Name 4 things you can physically feel.
Name 3 things you can hear.
Name 2 things you can smell or remember smelling.
Name 1 thing you can taste or imagine tasting.
Take a deep breath and notice the shift.

title: Temperature Change Grounding
description: Using temperature change to interrupt panic or dissociation.
steps: Hold something cold (ice cube, cold bottle).
Focus on the sensation for 30 seconds.
Name the texture and temperature.
Switch hands if needed.
Repeat until you feel more present.

title: Counting Down from 20
description: A cognitive grounding technique to calm fast or intrusive thoughts.
steps: Start at 20.
Count backward slowly.
If you lose track, restart.
Focus on numbers, not emotions.
Stop once breathing slows.

title: Feet-on-the-Floor Technique
description: A quick grounding exercise that centers attention on physical sensations.
steps: Sit or stand with both feet on the ground.
Press your heels gently into the floor.
Feel the texture and pressure.
Notice your weight shifting.
Take a slow breath.

title: Object Focus Grounding
description: A grounding practice by focusing on a single nearby object.
steps: Pick any object near you.
Describe its color and shape.
Describe its texture and temperature.
Describe its purpose.
Keep your mind on the object for 1–2 minutes.

title: Evening Reflection Journaling
description: A calming routine to process your day and prepare your mind for rest.
steps: Write down three events from today.
Note how each event made you feel.
Write one thing you're grateful for.
Write one thing you want to release.
Finish with a self-kind sentence.

title: Thought Dump Journaling
description: Empty your mind by writing everything running through your head.
steps: Write continuously for 3–5 minutes.
Do not censor or correct.
Let thoughts flow naturally.
Stop when you feel mental space opening.
Read and underline any patterns if you want.

title: Emotion Labeling
description: Labeling emotions reduces intensity and increases clarity.
steps: Write what you are feeling right now.
Assign each feeling a label (sadness, fear, anger).
Describe where you feel it in your body.
Write why you think it appeared.
Close with one supportive thought.

title: Positive Affirmation Writing
description: Write affirming statements to strengthen self-worth.
steps: Write 3 things you handled well today.
Write 3 personal strengths.
Write one affirmation you want to repeat.
Say the affirmation out loud once.
Keep it somewhere visible.

title: Goal Clarity Journaling
description: Clarify your goals to reduce uncertainty and stress.
steps: Write your main goal for this week.
Break it into 3 small steps.
Write the first step you can take today.
Identify one obstacle.
Write how you plan to overcome it.
